titleStmt.title: The two main questions resolved how 1 the ministers 2 the impropriators shall be maintained satisfied if tythes be put down. Often petitioned for, by several counties, and propounded and debated at a meeting not far from London, by divers eminent personages of this Common-wealth, and sundry freeholders, and others, attending on them. By D. Lupton, servant of Jesus Christ in the work of the Gospel.
titleStmt.author: Lupton, Donald, d. 1676.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by R.W. for R. Harford, at the Bible and States-Arms in Little-Brittain,

notesStmt.note: The words "The ministers .. impropriators" are bracketed together on title page, as are the words "shall be".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
